title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 October 2012 - XWiki

10:08 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:13 <vmassol> good morning  
10:13 <vmassol> I'd like to modify the TOC macro to add a new optional parameter called "reference". When set it generates the TOC for the passed reference. If not specified the TOC is for the current document. ok for you?  
10:15 <vmassol> just created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-240  
10:18 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <+tmortagne> vmassol: sounds good but what about a list of references so that you get a toc with the reference as first level and then the actual headers as second, etc. levels  
10:30 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <+tmortagne> one reference support can be done using a toc and an include macro  
10:31 <+tmortagne> well not exactly  
10:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: how do you do that?  
10:31 <+tmortagne> you have a use case for it already or it's just an idea ?  
10:31 <vmassol> see the issue  
10:31 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-240  
10:31 <vmassol> I've put a use case  
10:32 <vmassol> the one someone ask on irc yesterday  
10:32 <vmassol> and for which my only answer was https://gist.github.com/3853664  
10:32 <vmassol> (in a wiki macro)  
10:33 <+tmortagne> indeed even for the current document the current toc macro will not "work" in a panel  
10:35 <sburjan> has quit  
10:36 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:45 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have to add a method to TocMacroParameters to add a new param, this means breaking backward compat...  
10:59 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's not an interface  
11:00 <vmassol> hmm indeed  
11:48 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <mflorea> has quit  
12:03 <eshan> has joined #xwiki  
12:14 <jvelo> has quit  
12:17 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:06 <+mflorea> AndreasJonsson: in case you didn't notice, there are some validation tests failing after your changes to the stats pages http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/1824/testReport/  
14:10 <+mflorea> tmortagne: extension tests fail to start on CI http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/1105/testReport/org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4/JUnit4Provider/org\_xwiki\_test\_ui\_AllTests/ . Looks like some components are missing.  
14:13 <+tmortagne> mflorea: hmm java.lang.NullPointerException, checking  
14:19 <+tmortagne> mflorea: looks like there is a bug in CompositeConfigurationSource#getKeys, I will have to look at it  
14:19 <+mflorea> ok  
14:22 <cdop> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <cdop> ok, got the TOC-Panel up and running :)  
14:36 <vmassol> cdop: cool  
14:37 <cdop> Thank you :)  
14:37 <vmassol> cdop: np, I'm trying to make it easier to implement your use case  
14:58 <+tmortagne> mflorea: found why, getKeys() return null in all the wiki based ConfigurationSource... fixing that  
14:59 <+mflorea> great, thanks!  
15:00 <+AndreasJonsson> mflorea: I see, I'll fix the errors.  
15:01 <+mflorea> thanks!  
15:01 <+AndreasJonsson> BTW, when converting from syntax 1.0, wich target syntax should be preferred?  2.0 or 2.1?  
15:02 <+evalica> 2.1  
15:02 <+evalica> the latest  
15:03 <+evalica> and they are very similar and compatible  
15:04 <+AndreasJonsson> Ok, then I'll change to syntax 2.1 while I'm at it.  
15:09 <+mflorea> jvdrean: 2 functional tests related to panels ( http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/1818/testReport/ ) have been failing for the last 22 builds. Did you make some changes to the panels? After a quick investigation is seems that left/right panel column is not displayed aymore if empty. I.e. even if you configure the page layout to show left/right panels, the column is not displayed if empt  
15:10 <jvelo> has quit  
15:13 <vmassol> AndreasJonsson: that's a good question becuase we haven't really discussed it nor defined a target/plan tomove from 2.0 to 2.1  
15:14 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
15:14 <+jvdrean> vmassol: I'm looking at what I committed but I don't see how it lead to that  
15:14 <+jvdrean> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b93e1faf98a378a9b2c6cf844afca5cec1295b17  
15:34 <vmassol> has quit  
15:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:44 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
15:47 <+sburjan> Hello. DId anyone worked with Advanced Search on Github ?  
15:47 <+sburjan> I am interested if someone know how to combine those filters. I tried a lot of combination, but I'm not able to combine the 2 I need  
15:54 <cdop> ok guys, how would you import your dokuwiki-wiki into xwiki?  
15:57 <+Enygma`> sburjan use git log on you local clone  
15:57 <+sburjan> Enygma`: I need to search on github.  
15:57 <+Enygma`> for what?  
15:59 <+Enygma`> if it's code related, then use git, otherwise (repository/people) I can`t help you :)  
16:01 <vmassol> cdop: we don't have any dokuwiki syntax parser ATM … we do have a lot but not this one…  
16:01 <vmassol> cdop: so you have several options  
16:02 <vmassol> 1) copy paste the HTML into the WYSIWYG editor (there's a button for entering HTML) and when you save it'll be converted to wiki syntax  
16:02 <vmassol> 2) write some scripts in whatever language you wish to convert the syntax. Examples can be found in extensions  
16:03 <vmassol> ah wait  
16:03 <vmassol> there are 3 extensions that exist apparently  
16:03 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Import+DokuWiki+into+XWiki+Application  
16:03 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Dokuwiki+To+XWiki2+Extension  
16:03 <vmassol> s/"/é  
16:03 <vmassol> s/3/2  
16:03 <vmassol> :)  
16:04 <vmassol> this one sounds good: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Import+DokuWiki+into+XWiki+Application  
16:04 <vmassol> you're lucky :)  
16:04 <+sburjan> Enygma`: I need to use the github search feature to search something specific in our platform repo. After, I will have to see if I can make this search using their Search API. I'm trying to do something automatic, for link generation.  
16:05 <cdop> vmassol: thanks :)  
16:05 <vmassol> you need both extensions actually, you'll see in the doc  
16:05 <+sburjan> Enygma`: I am searching code, and I want to combine repo: and path: and they don't seem to love each other. even that they state the filters are stackable  
16:12 <+mflorea> jvdrean: I commented on your commit.  
16:14 <cdop> vmassol: well gonna find out - but at least there is a start :)  
16:14 <vmassol> yup  
16:20 <jvelo> has quit  
16:24 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:30 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:43 <sburjan> has quit  
16:45 <cdop> bbl  
16:45 <cdop> has quit  
16:47 <jvelo> has quit  
16:48 <vmassol> guys  
16:48 <vmassol> reminder: here's what we had decided on improving quality at the xwiki sas seminar:  
16:48 <vmassol> \* Find dead code (using TPC is great for that). -Caleb  
16:48 <vmassol> \* Run automated functional tests on various environments - Sorin  
16:48 <vmassol> \* Fail the build in java modules on unsufficient TPC for unit tests with excludes feature: 50%. -- Vincent  
16:48 <vmassol> \* Sonar find rules and propose have them in build - Marius  
16:48 <vmassol> \* Create JMeter scenario in build (and run them at each release) - Fabio [Thomas, Marius]  
16:48 <vmassol> \* Regular Days (one day per final release) - Bug fixing, legacy,test, doc - Vincent  
16:49 <vmassol> I know you're all busy  
16:49 <vmassol> but when you get time, don't forget to progress on your tasks ;)  
16:50 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki

17:51 <fmancinelli> has quit  
18:05 <Slashman> hello everyone, I'm looking for a way to create a table with 4 column with 25% of the available space as size, I ddidn't find anything in the documentation about size in table, any idea?  
18:07 <@cjd> Slashman: I think you can use regular CSS on a table using (% style="..." %) above the table  
18:11 <Slashman> cjd: in wiki2.1 syntax?  
18:11 <Slashman> trying  
18:12 <+tmortagne> Slashman: yes (%%) syntax allow you to insert pretty much any html properties on any element of the table  
18:16 <Slashman> tmortagne: okay, thanks !

18:52 <vmassol> the new attachment upload  
18:52 <vmassol> you cannot upload more than 1 attachment  
18:52 <vmassol> there's no button to add a second one  
18:54 <vmassol> you need to click on hide  upload status  
18:54 <vmassol> creating jira issue

19:02 <vmassol> cjd: it's in our nexus  
19:02 <vmassol> I've proxied their repo  
19:02 <@cjd> hmm ok, then it's my broken config  
19:02 <vmassol> till it gets installed at central

19:04 <vmassol> sburjan`: sure but that's not the problem (even though that's "hidden")  
19:07 <@cjd> worked this time w/o any changes -- another maven bug

21:01 <mrvanes> Could somebody be so nice to translate these OUTPUTS/CUSTOM\_OUTPUT lines to the new OUTPUT format?  
21:01 <mrvanes> OUTPUTS = (u'mopidy.outputs.custom.CustomOutput',)  
21:01 <mrvanes> CUSTOM\_OUTPUT = u'audioresample ! alsasink device=dmyxer\_vlc'

21:08 <mrvanes> It's working now
